name: Democratic Socialism Simulator
abstract: This is a list of all Nintendo Switch games that I’ve paid actual, cold, hard money for.
words: nothing says ‘happy new year’ like the thought of political upheaval, and nothing gets you closer to the pretence than
in practice, democratic socialism simulator — i’m gonna call that dss from now — is neither the strongest
, although it does offer an accessible dose of political fantasy, a diversion if you’re into that kind of thing.
i’m playing dss because i’m finally dipping into the massive collection of games on itch.io that was/is the
bundle for racial justice and equality
. there are 593 ‘games’ for mac in the package, and i’d love to see how many i can get reviewed in a year.

so, dss is a pretty slick simulation of a us presedential term, complete with midterms and re-election. the title is going to put a lot of people of, no doubt. i think that’s a shame because the game is more rounded than this implies, although it’s hardly a deep and meaningful exploration into the machinations of statecraft.
do well, and you’ll gain more control of congress. not congress, though; this game won’t help you there.
dss is not the kind of game i’d recommend paying good money for. maybe that’s the point, though — maybe you
avoid any traditionally capitalist methods of acquiring the game and share it with the collective...
